link_counts.title: Can't send msgs from Windows desktop client

posts.cooked:
hi. did the blocking started recently for you? were you able to bypass it?
some of my contact in Russia also reported blocking today

posts.name: михаил веретен
posts.cooked:
it all started today, on smartphone it works only with this option enabled (see picture), the PC version does not have this option.

5310306580367007395938×1280 75.6 KB

posts.name: just to report
posts.cooked:
Hi, it Signal is blocked in Russia now. There is a constant notification on “getting new messages” with a running progress bar, but the messages are not updated and the calls are not working. I don’t have debuglogs unfortunately, but several contacts in Russia confirmed this. Censorship resistance settings was not activated automatically. Maybe it’s time to activate the censorship resistant connection feature flag for the region? Or maybe you can investigate it further. Thank you very much in advance.

On globalcheck.net you can verify that Signal domains are blocked on every of the largest Russians ISP:

2024-08-09_12-42-03-448_firefox_IL81162×621 49.7 KB

2024-08-09_12-43-18-283_firefox_Rou1161×617 50.3 KB

2024-08-09_12-43-56-834_firefox_ZMY1149×613 51.7 KB

posts.name: михаил веретен
posts.cooked:
Мессенджер Signal заблокирован в РФ за нарушение законодательства, сообщает Роскомнадзор.

сообщает тг канал Раньше всех

As of now, you can use GoodbyeDPI or similar options on desktop.

github.com

GitHub - ValdikSS/GoodbyeDPI: GoodbyeDPI — Deep Packet Inspection circumvention...

GoodbyeDPI — Deep Packet Inspection circumvention utility (for Windows)

link_counts.title: GitHub - ValdikSS/GoodbyeDPI: GoodbyeDPI — Deep Packet Inspection circumvention utility (for Windows)

posts.name: Radar
posts.cooked: I use it, but it does not affect the operation of the messenger in any way.

posts.name: михаил веретен
posts.cooked:
I’ve added these lines to the goodbyeDPI blacklist:
cdn.signal.org
sfu.voip.signal.org.
chat.signal.org

No problems with connection, but messages sometimes take a long time to leave, can you tell me what lines should be added to the blacklist?

If you’re using default blacklist, probably there are no signal servers yet. You can add them manually. I cannot test it but hope it helps.

signal.org

might be enough

Here’s the list

chat.signal.org
cdn2.signal.org
storage.signal.org
sfu.voip.signal.org
updates2.signal.org
uptime.signal.org

posts.name: just to report
posts.cooked:
Signal messenger blocked in Russia, says Roskomnadzor

https://www.reuters.com/technology/signal-messenger-blocked-russia-says-roskomnadzor-ifax-2024-08-09/

posts.name: михаил веретен
posts.cooked:
Yes, it works! Thank you @defltare

  1. download GoodbyeDPI
  2. in the file russia-blacklist.txt add:
    signal.org
    chat.signal.org
    cdn2.signal.org
    storage.signal.org
    sfu.voip.signal.org
    updates2.signal.org
    uptime.signal.org
  3. Run 1_russia_blacklist.cmd.

posts.name: Radar
posts.cooked:
[defltare] , [dtpmikegp]
Thanks a lot! It works.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Mastodon – 9 Aug 24

Signal (@signalapp@mastodon.world)

We're aware of reports that access to Signal has been blocked in some countries. As a reminder, Signal's built-in censorship circumvention feature might be able to help if your connection is affected: Signal Settings > Privacy > Advanced >...

(thread)
